column1: # Use as many lines of text as you need.
# All text following the "Method:" keyword will be regarded as part of your free text methods description.

Frequency calculations for all the microstates are done at their optimized structures in gas phase and implicit solvent model (SMD model is used here) to obtain the free energy in aqueous solution phase.
M06-2X/6-31G* is used for neutral (NEU) and positively (POS) charged microstates
column2: and M06-2X/6-31+G* is used for neutral (NEU) and negatively (NEG) charged microstates.

column1: The free energy in aqueous solution for each microstate is
Then the partition function for each microstate is exp(-G/kT). Here T is the temperature at Kelvin (which is set as 298.15)
column2: k is the Boltzmann constant (0.0019872036 kcal/(mol*K)).

column1: So the macroscopic pKa will be pKa(n+1/n)=-\lg\sum\exp(-G(n)/kT)+\lg\sum\exp(-G(n+1)/kT)+G(H)/(kT\ln(10)). Here G(H) is the free energy of a proton in aqueous solution
